idioms.meaning: the (fast) pace at which life passes, and thus the nearness of death

lessons.japanese: 苦情は出来るだけ迅速に処理されるよう取り計らいなさい。
lessons.english: Make sure that the complaints are dealt with as quickly as possible.

lessons.japanese: 貴社からのどんなご注文にも、迅速に対処します。
lessons.english: Any orders you place with us will be processed promptly.

lessons.japanese: 間髪を入れず、迅速かつ的確な応対、畏れ入ります。
lessons.english: Such an accurate, lightning-quick reply. What can I say?

lessons.japanese: あなたの迅速な返事が是非とも必要です。
lessons.english: Your prompt reply is urgently required.

lessons.japanese: 彼はその事態に迅速に対応した。
lessons.english: He promptly coped with the situation.

lessons.japanese: 彼の迅速な行動により伝染病を防ぐことができた。
lessons.english: His prompt action prevented an epidemic.

lessons.japanese: 世界は環境危機に対処して本当に迅速に行動しただろうか。
lessons.english: Did the world really act as fast as possible to meet the threat to the environment?

lessons.japanese: 迅速な行動をとれば、将来起こる問題の予防になる。
lessons.english: Prompt action prevents trouble in the future.

lessons.japanese: 事務所の職員は迅速かつ効率的に働いて、その問題を解決した。
lessons.english: The office staff worked quickly and efficiently to resolve the problem.

lessons.japanese: 研修によって、従業員の非常事態への対応を迅速化できる。
lessons.english: Training conditions workers to react quickly to an emergency.

lessons.japanese: 警察は暴動に対処するため迅速な行動をとった。
lessons.english: The police took immediate action to deal with the riot.

lessons.japanese: 苦情は出来るだけ迅速に処理されるよう取り計らいなさい。
lessons.english: Make sure that the complaints are dealt with as quickly as possible.
